intro: Glechon affinis, commonly known as the pink rock rose, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae and is characterized by its compact, mat-forming growth habit. The plant produces clusters of small, pink or white flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are typically narrow and gray-green, adapted to thrive in rocky or sandy soils. Glechon affinis is drought-tolerant and often found in coastal or Mediterranean climates.
